p:
Spartina densiflora was documented in Washington a decade ago. The first collection was made in 2001 on Whidbey Island at the northern boundary of Puget Sound (Heimer 01-1 WTU, UBC). Caplow (2002) reported a 1/10 acre infestation of
Spartina densiflora at the west end of Grays Harbor ( 46.9408°N, 124.04583°W) in the southeastern part of the state. By 2006 this infestation had expanded substantially, covering some 10 acres ( Murphy et al. 2007). Kozloff (2005) included
Spartina densiflora in his
Spartina treatment, noting only ‘coastal salt marshes’ as its distribution.
